name: sfchronicle
text:
A Bay Area assemblyman will revise his bill requiring that mail ballots be sent to to every California voter after concerns arose that the current version could cause more problems than it would solve.

https://t.co/B92X9LxIe0

name: sfchronicle
text:
"My brother was kneeling and surrendering": Family of SF man killed by Vallejo police disputes chief’s narrative.

Story by @MeganRCassidy & @ctuan: https://t.co/QESiSNqjNE

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Hundreds of cars parade out of Golden Gate Park late Thursday afternoon to show solidarity with the recent protests.  The caravan IS scheduled to do a 10-mile loop through San Francisco. https://t.co/aSpx3VWItd

name: sfchronicle
text:
Many CVS and Walgreens locations in the Bay Area remain shuttered after some stores were vandalized and looted. 

Here's a list of the closest open stores to you (store hours vary by location so call ahead): https://t.co/sSqZIFfxJ8

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Hundreds of demonstrators fill Fernandez Park in Pinole as part of a “George Floyd Solidarity” protest. The demonstration, which was led by black and community organizers of color, is scheduled to include a march to the Pinole Police Department.  https://t.co/6BA1GH5Ni4

name: sfchronicle
text: PROTEST UPDATES: Police say “several hundred” protesters are peacefully marching down El Camino Real toward Rengstorff Avenue in Mountain View shortly after 5:30 p.m. https://t.co/MPqfTteQYL

name: sfchronicle
text: Gov. Gavin Newsom says he’s concerned about the spread of coronavirus as protests against police brutality continue across the state. “If you’re not (concerned), you’re not paying attention ... to the virulence of this disease,” he said in Stockton. https://t.co/lqK7YRAI3i https://t.co/ee0G1rVT8z

name: sfchronicle
text:
Lunchtime yoga — six feet apart, of course — in front of the @calacademy colony of African penguins takes care of two birds with one pose. 

Staff gets a healthful, anxiety-reducing break, and the penguins get their “people TV” back.

https://t.co/QSKdPu6uwW

name: sfchronicle
text:
Here are several options for movies to watch to better understand this historic moment:

https://t.co/7M9r0ZhMB7

name: sfchronicle
text: A car caravan protest against against the Minneapolis police killing of George Floyd turns into 6th Ave from Anza S… https://t.co/aB2FHLVFTv

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Solano County’s 8 p.m. curfew is lifted Thursday morning. Some cities in the county have curfews still in effect, including Vallejo. https://t.co/IOzXaRfieu

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Several hundred people who congregated at Oakland City Hall begin marching up Telegraph Avenue before turning onto W. Grand Avenue. They chanted “No justice, no peace” and held cardboard signs overhead while nearby cars honked in support. https://t.co/y1sozd7mCh

name: sfchronicle
text: In Oakland, protesters chanting "No justice, no peace," march from Telegraph Ave. to West Grand Ave., against the M… https://t.co/0p7KQ7cbQI

name: sfchronicle
text: Protesters in Oakland met a line of CHP officers at 14th and Brush as they marched toward the freeway overpass. Sho… https://t.co/Z6Sw0eSToQ

name: sfchronicle
text: Another group of former Grand Princess passengers is suing Carnival Corp. and its Princess cruise line, alleging the line was aware of coronavirus infections on another ship but did not take measures to protect passengers. https://t.co/bb8I9jwW8b

name: sfchronicle
text:
San Francisco officials say they’re committed to taking a portion of the police department’s budget and redirecting it to the city’s African American community. 

https://t.co/g9w3Fs01hI

name: sfchronicle
text: The new rules “will reverse decades of effort to end the corrosive effects of sexual harassment on equal access to education,” lawyers for 17 states and the District of Columbia said in a federal court filing.  https://t.co/aNpd9B0WUS

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: The city of Concord’s curfew, which police said was formed in “response to the unpredictable nature of the civil unrest in the region,” will remain in effect until Monday, June 8.  https://t.co/Yl9e8N6ZEE
